body: Hi thanks for the report; can you expand on what this means? 'Ubuntu 20.04.3 virtualized` can you confirm the bash terminal launches? in my hands on 20.04 and macOS it does launch, so I am wondering if this is about your installation. Note, you don't need CUDA installed outside of the docker.

Hi thanks for your reply. I'm running Ubuntu 20.04 virtualized on a hypervisor. Its just a minor note, it should not matter for software's sake. Ubuntu runs as expected, bash terminal, monitor control, etc. I also have SSH enabled and remote access via [shell.](url)

I can try it again without installing CUDA and just the Nvidia driver installed

![Screen Shot 2021-12-17 at 11 24 08 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13802587/146576060-6148e1fe-dbf2-43a0-baf0-bad130391a2e.png)
.

here is the workflow I recommend:  
https://deeplabcut.github.io/DeepLabCut/docs/docker.html

`pip install deeplabcut-docker`


then:

`deeplabcut-docker bash -v /home/ryan:/home/ryan`

and not within ./local/bin; first "cd" to a home folder.

I.e., can you not run as ./deeplabcut_docker.sh

Hello, `deeplabcut-docker bash -v /home/ryan:/home/ryan` works and so does `.local/bin/deeplabcut-docker bash -v /home/ryan:/home/ryan` but both `deeplabcut-docker gui bash -v /home/ryan:/home/ryan` and `.local/bin/deeplabcut-docker gui bash -v /home/ryan:/home/ryan` result in the same `Failed to launch the DLC GUI` error.

I'm wondering if the issue is that the monitor doesn't have GPU acceleration.
I wouldn't expect that to matter though since the Tesla card is recognized and used for compute--especially over X11 forwarding.

okay, great that the Docker does launch, so it's just an X11 issue; for this: 

can you try running:

`echo $DISPLAY`

`xhost + $IP`

rename.from: DeepLabCut Docker fails to launch via deeplabcut-docker gui and deeplabcut_docker.sh
rename.to: `Failed to launch the DLC GUI. Used args: "-e DISPLAY=unix:1 ...`

body:
Could you help clarify if my goal is to use the GUI version if I need to use `pip install deeplabcut-docker` or `pip install "deeplabcut-docker[gui]"`?

When I use `pip install "deeplabcut-docker[gui]"` I get the following error around building wxpython: https://pastebin.com/rEGJaX3x

The outputs for your commands are: `:1` and `access control disabled, clients can connect from any host`

Hello @crsleeth , `pip install deeplabcut-docker` is correct, there is no extra `gui` variant of the `deeplabcut-docker`  package ─ it is simply a helper script to pull and start the images.

The outputs you got look correct. Could you check whether the following sequence can be reproduced on your machine (assuming you previously installed the `deeplabcut-docker` package):

```
$ xhost + 
access control disabled, clients can connect from any host
$ deeplabcut-docker gui

Welcome to DeepLabCut docker!

latest-gui: Pulling from deeplabcut/deeplabcut
Digest: sha256:3f08a9e7ee3b0d9ab9905cb13114363c70a012d656b5662b1dd888d9cbce43ad
Status: Image is up to date for deeplabcut/deeplabcut:latest-gui
docker.io/deeplabcut/deeplabcut:latest-gui
[2021-12-18T02:04:27+0100]: Configuring a local container for user stes (1000) in group stes (1000)
sha256:266cf94a1abe1c4c25b750bb8ac1bd867527b3a8aef4d66f61a6262aedc34249
[2021-12-18T02:04:27+0100]: Build succeeded
[2021-12-18T02:04:27+0100]: Using Linux config
2021-12-18 01:04:28.201335: I tensorflow/stream_executor/platform/default/dso_loader.cc:53] Successfully opened dynamic library libcudart.so.11.0
Starting GUI...
```

If not, could you please provide the full error messages you get by running these commands?

This is the full error message: [pastebin.com/W7JYLKAr](https://pastebin.com/W7JYLKAr)

I also get an Ubuntu error when I run that command with `gnome-shell` so I think it may be incompatible with my virtualized setup.

To test this I installed Ubuntu on the bare metal instead of virtualized through Debian/Proxmox (with the Tesla M40 passed through) and am able to run DLC without issue like one would expect.

I'd be interested to know if any other users are using DLC with GPUs in virtualized server setups instead of just workstations. And if anyone is using Tesla cards vs. GTX/RTX cards.

issue.title: `Failed to launch the DLC GUI. Used args: "-e DISPLAY=unix -v /tmp/.X11-unix:` [duplicate issue]

issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Bug description

In a running docker build upon the image `deeplabcut/deeplabcut:latest-gui-jupyter`, importing deeplabcut gives the error message `Cannot load backend 'WXAgg' which requires the 'wx' interactive framework, as 'headless' is currently running`

### Operating System

WSL2 with Ubuntu-20.04
Docker version 20.10.11

### DeepLabCut version

`pip list | grep deeplabcut` gives `2.2.0.2`.

### DeepLabCut mode

single animal

### Device type

CPU

### Steps To Reproduce

1. `docker pull deeplabcut/deeplabcut:latest-gui-jupyter`
2. start the container building upon the image
3. `ipython`
4. `import deeplabcut`

### Relevant log output

```shell
In [9]: import deeplabcut
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
ImportError                               Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-9-cfa4f159dfc5> in <module>
----> 1 import deeplabcut

/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/deeplabcut/__init__.py in <module>
     24     import wx
     25
---> 26     mpl.use("WxAgg")
     27     from deeplabcut import generate_training_dataset
     28     from deeplabcut import refine_training_dataset

/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/matplotlib/__init__.py in use(backend, force)
   1078                 # user does not have the libraries to support their
   1079                 # chosen backend installed.
-> 1080                 plt.switch_backend(name)
   1081             except ImportError:
   1082                 if force:

/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/matplotlib/pyplot.py in switch_backend(newbackend)
    283         if (current_framework and required_framework
    284                 and current_framework != required_framework):
--> 285             raise ImportError(
    286                 "Cannot load backend {!r} which requires the {!r} interactive "
    287                 "framework, as {!r} is currently running".format(

ImportError: Cannot load backend 'WXAgg' which requires the 'wx' interactive framework, as 'headless' is currently running
```
```


### Anything else?

_No response_

### Code of Conduct

- [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md)

issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Bug description

The initial bug comes in the following way:
```
>>> import deeplabcut
2022-02-17 06:18:16.078540: I tensorflow/stream_executor/platform/default/dso_loader.cc:53] Successfully opened dynamic library libcudart.so.11.0
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/deeplabcut/__init__.py", line 28, in <module>
    from deeplabcut import generate_training_dataset
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/deeplabcut/generate_training_dataset/__init__.py", line 12, in <module>
    from deeplabcut.generate_training_dataset.trainingsetmanipulation import *
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/deeplabcut/generate_training_dataset/trainingsetmanipulation.py", line 23, in <module>
    from deeplabcut.pose_estimation_tensorflow import training
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/deeplabcut/pose_estimation_tensorflow/__init__.py", line 12, in <module>
    from deeplabcut.pose_estimation_tensorflow.datasets import *
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/deeplabcut/pose_estimation_tensorflow/datasets/__init__.py", line 11, in <module>
    from .pose_deterministic import DeterministicPoseDataset
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/deeplabcut/pose_estimation_tensorflow/datasets/pose_deterministic.py", line 19, in <module>
    from deeplabcut.utils.auxfun_videos import imread, imresize
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/deeplabcut/utils/__init__.py", line 6, in <module>
    from deeplabcut.utils.make_labeled_video import *
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/deeplabcut/utils/make_labeled_video.py", line 26, in <module>
    import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/matplotlib/pyplot.py", line 2500, in <module>
    switch_backend(rcParams["backend"])
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/matplotlib/pyplot.py", line 285, in switch_backend
    raise ImportError(
ImportError: Cannot load backend 'WXAgg' which requires the 'wx' interactive framework, as 'headless' is currently running
```
I searched the issues in DeepLabCut and other materials, and located the minimum reproducible bug enviroment as follow:
```
>>> import wx
>>> import matplotlib
>>> matplotlib.use('WXagg')
>>> import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/matplotlib/pyplot.py", line 2500, in <module>
    switch_backend(rcParams["backend"])
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/matplotlib/pyplot.py", line 285, in switch_backend
    raise ImportError(
ImportError: Cannot load backend 'WXAgg' which requires the 'wx' interactive framework, as 'headless' is currently running
```

Change the backend of matplotlib GUI to "Agg" has no import problem as below:
```import wx
import matplotlib
matplotlib.use('Agg')
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
```


so I revised the matplotlib backend in 
`/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/deeplabcut/__init__.py`,  in this way, the `import deeplabcut` works.

```
import matplotlib as mpl
try:
    import wx
    #mpl.use("WxAgg")
    mpl.use("Agg")
```

However, the sub-modules and functions somewhere else in this package are solely designated as `WXagg`, such as the follow
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24669435/154421170-a98b96f9-0732-474b-92c9-7528af3b1a3e.png)
so the workaround way of setting as "Agg" backend also failed work


### Operating System

Ubuntu 18.04 on a desktop machine, i.e., with a monitor connected to it

### DeepLabCut version

DeepLabCut version `2.2.0.2` from the below docker image:
`docker pull deeplabcut/deeplabcut:latest-gui-jupyter`


### DeepLabCut mode

single animal

### Device type

CPU

### Steps To Reproduce

```
>>>docker pull deeplabcut/deeplabcut:latest-gui-jupyter
>>>docker run -it --privileged=true --net=host deeplabcut/deeplabcut:latest-gui-jupyter /bin/bash 
>>>python3
>>>import deeplabcut
```

### Relevant log output

```shell
as pointed in https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/issues/1538,
I checked 
cat /etc/gdm3/custom.conf | grep WaylandEnable
echo $XDG_SESSION_TYPE
echo $DISPLAY
And the outputs are
MaylandEnable=false
x11
:0
```


### Anything else?

_No response_

### Code of Conduct

- [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md)

@MMathisLab I experimented with setting up deeplabcut-docker gui on Ubuntu 20.04 with the goal of having multiple concurrent, simultaneous, graphically accelerated, remote sessions but was unsuccessful. Even with multiple graphically accelerated VNC sessions (confirmed by running [Unigine Heaven](https://benchmark.unigine.com/heaven) and possible by utilizing [VirtualGL](https://virtualgl.org/)) I would still get the `ImportError: Cannot load backend 'WXAgg' which requires the 'wx' interactive framework, as 'headless' is currently running` error.

Non graphically accelerated sessions also didn't work, obviously. I tested many including NoMachine, ThinLinc, and XRDP.

It seems that the way deeplabcut-docker gui is setup requires local console :0. This can be accessed remotely via some session software, but multiple concurrent sessions never worked.

So unless someone more technical than me can figure it out it seems the only way of splitting up a GPU's (in my case a Tesla M40 24 GB) resources for deeplabcut-docker gui is with GPU partitioning via a hypervisor like VMware + Nvidia GRID or Windows Server Hyper-V + RemoteFX/GPU-P then creating multiple virtual machines each with their own slice of the GPU so that they can each present a localhost :0 console for deeplabcut-docker gui.

I tried deeplabcut-docker gui on Windows via Docker Desktop and got the same error:

```
2022-03-04 08:09:05.762353: I tensorflow/stream_executor/platform/default/dso_loader.cc:53] Successfully opened dynamic library libcudart.so.11.0
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python3.8/runpy.py", line 185, in _run_module_as_main
    mod_name, mod_spec, code = _get_module_details(mod_name, _Error)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.8/runpy.py", line 144, in _get_module_details
    return _get_module_details(pkg_main_name, error)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.8/runpy.py", line 111, in _get_module_details
    __import__(pkg_name)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/deeplabcut/__init__.py", line 27, in <module>
    from deeplabcut import generate_training_dataset
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/deeplabcut/generate_training_dataset/__init__.py", line 12, in <module>
    from deeplabcut.generate_training_dataset.trainingsetmanipulation import *
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/deeplabcut/generate_training_dataset/trainingsetmanipulation.py", line 23, in <module>
    from deeplabcut.pose_estimation_tensorflow import training
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/deeplabcut/pose_estimation_tensorflow/__init__.py", line 12, in <module>
    from deeplabcut.pose_estimation_tensorflow.datasets import *
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/deeplabcut/pose_estimation_tensorflow/datasets/__init__.py", line 11, in <module>
    from .pose_deterministic import DeterministicPoseDataset
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/deeplabcut/pose_estimation_tensorflow/datasets/pose_deterministic.py", line 19, in <module>
    from deeplabcut.utils.auxfun_videos import imread, imresize
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/deeplabcut/utils/__init__.py", line 6, in <module>
    from deeplabcut.utils.make_labeled_video import *
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/deeplabcut/utils/make_labeled_video.py", line 26, in <module>
    import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/matplotlib/pyplot.py", line 2500, in <module>
    switch_backend(rcParams["backend"])
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/matplotlib/pyplot.py", line 285, in switch_backend
    raise ImportError(
ImportError: Cannot load backend 'WXAgg' which requires the 'wx' interactive framework, as 'headless' is currently running
```

issue.title: ImportError: Cannot load backend 'WXAgg' which requires the 'wx' interactive framework, as 'headless' is currently running

repository.name: DeepLabCut
repository.description: Official implementation of DeepLabCut: Markerless pose estimation of user-defined features with deep learning for all animals incl. humans

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Bug description

After a fresh install of docker for my ubuntu 18.04 system, I successfully pulled the deeplabcut-latest-gui-jupyter image from Dockerhub.  However, when I call 'deeplabcut-docker gui' on my terminal I get the following output:
> "ImportError: Cannot load backend 'WXAgg' which requires the 'wx' interactive framework, as 'headless' is currently running
[2022-04-27T12:14:09-0700]: Failed to launch the DLC GUI. Used args: "-e DISPLAY=unix -v /tmp/.X11-unix:/tmp/.X11-unix -v :/home/developer/.Xauthority -v /home/carmen:/app -w /app "
Container stopped.

I'm wondering if this has anything to do with the fact that I don't have an NVIDIA GPU, and I haven't been able to install an NVIDIA driver for that reason.  I'm also new to WSL and Ubuntu, so possibly I am just misunderstanding some basic installation concept.  Any help would be greatly appreciated!

### Operating System

Ubuntu 18.04

### DeepLabCut version

N/A

### DeepLabCut mode

single animal

### Device type

Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL) on Windows 11 Home 64-bit
Intel(R) UHD Graphics

### Steps To Reproduce

In Ubuntu 18.04:

> from https://docs.docker.com/engine/install/ubuntu/:
``` 
 sudo apt-get update
 sudo apt-get install \
    ca-certificates \
    curl \
    gnupg \
    lsb-release
curl -fsSL https://download.docker.com/linux/ubuntu/gpg | sudo gpg --dearmor -o /usr/share/keyrings/docker-archive-keyring.gpg
echo \
  "deb [arch=$(dpkg --print-architecture) signed-by=/usr/share/keyrings/docker-archive-keyring.gpg] https://download.docker.com/linux/ubuntu \
  $(lsb_release -cs) stable" | sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/docker.list > /dev/null
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install docker-ce docker-ce-cli containerd.io docker-compose-plugin

```
After running `sudo docker run hello-world` I get the correct message printed.

> from 	https://hub.docker.com/r/deeplabcut/deeplabcut/tags:

```
docker pull deeplabcut/deeplabcut:latest-gui-jupyter'
```

> Install DLC helper, finish other setup steps

```pip install deeplabcut-docker
sudo groupadd docker
sudo usermod -aG docker $USER
sudo reboot
deeplabcut-docker gui
```

### Relevant log output

```shell

//____/ \__/ \__// .__//____/\_,_//_.__/\___/ \_,_/ \__/  \
\_________________________________________________________/
                       ___)( )(___ `-.___.
                      (((__) (__)))      ~`

Welcome to DeepLabCut docker!
